Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Shorten the path lengths

Shorten the length of temporary file and UNIX domain socket paths.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/57005#issuecomment-2666921592

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [doc] Fix the type of the `data` argument

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [security] Use more descriptive text for 2017 vulnerability link

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [security] Add new DoS vulnerability to SECURITY.md

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[security] Fix crash when the Upgrade header cannot be read (#2231)

It is possible that the Upgrade header is correctly received and handled
(the `'upgrade'` event is emitted) without its value being returned to
the user. This can happen if the number of received headers exceed the
`server.maxHeadersCount` or `request.maxHeadersCount` threshold. In this
case `incomingMessage.headers.upgrade` may not be set.

Handle the case correctly and abort the handshake.

Fixes #2230

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[perf] Reduce the amount of `crypto.randomFillSync()` calls

Use a pool of random bytes to reduce the amount of
`crypto.randomFillSync()` calls.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/undici/pull/3204

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Use the `highWaterMark` variable

Use the value of the `highWaterMark` variable instead of `16384`.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Flip the default value of `allowSynchronousEvents` (#2221)

Flip the default value of the `allowSynchronousEvents` option to `true`.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/2218

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Emit at most one event per event loop iteration (#2218)

Fixes #2216

Author: Tim Perry
Message:
[feature] Allow the `createConnection` option (#2219)

Allow passing in a custom `createConnection` function.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Introduce the `autoPong` option

Add the ability to disable the automatic sending of pong responses to
pings.

Fixes #2186

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Rename the `allowMultipleEventsPerMicrotask` option

Rename the `allowMultipleEventsPerMicrotask` option to
`allowSynchronousEvents`.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Emit the event when the microtask is executed

Emit the `'message'`, `'ping'`, and `'pong'` event when the microtask
for that event is executed.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Introduce the `allowMultipleEventsPerMicrotask` option

The `allowMultipleEventsPerMicrotask` option allows the `'message'`,
`'ping'`, and `'pong'` events to be emitted more than once per
microtask.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/2160

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Add missing rejection handler

Use `queueMicrotask()` when available and add a rejection handler to the
shim for it.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [doc] Fix the type of the `socket` argument

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[pkg] Remove native-duplexpair dev dependency

It seems to be no longer maintained.

Author: Tim Perry
Message: [fix] Make `server.handleUpgrade()` work with any duplex stream (#2165)

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Allow http and https schemes (#2162)

Allow HTTP(S) URLs to be used in the WebSocket constructor. They are
immediately converted to the ws and wss schemes.

Refs: https://github.com/whatwg/websockets/pull/45

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Emit at most one event per microtask (#2160)

To improve compatibility with the WHATWG standard, emit at most one of
`'message'`, `'ping'`, and `'pong'` events per tick.

Fixes #2159

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [test] Reduce message size from 20 MiB to 4 MiB

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [ci] Run the lint step on node 20

Author: Matthijs van Duin
Message:
[feature] Add option to support late addition of headers (#2123)

This supports the use-case where headers need to be added that depend on
the socket connection (e.g. for TLS channel binding).

Author: Matthijs van Duin
Message:
[test] Fix failing test when using the domain module (#2126)

Fix a failure in `test/create-websocket-stream.test.js` if the domain
module is loaded (e.g. due to `NODE_OPTIONS` in environment).

The cause of the failure was that installing an `'uncaughtException'`
event handler on `process` causes the domain module to prepend its own
handler for the same event, which confused the test.

Fixes #2124

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[doc] Add error handlers to examples and code snippets

Closes #2112

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [minor] Make `sendAfterClose()` call the callback in the next tick

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[perf] Make `toBuffer()` use `FastBuffer`

Skip unnecessary parameter validation performed by `Buffer.from()` when
possible.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[perf] Use `FastBuffer` instead of `Buffer#subarray()`

`Buffer.prototype.subarray()` performance is subpar on
Node.js < 16.15.0.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Validate the payload length of the close frame sooner

Avoid unnecessary work if the payload length is 1.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[doc] Improve doc for the `callback` argument of `WebSocketServer`

Clarify that the `callback` argument is added as a listener for the
`'listening'` event only when the `port` option is set.

Fixes #2100

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Add the same event listener only once

Prevent `WebSocket.prototype.addEventListener()` from adding the same
event listener multiple times.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Add support for objets with a `handleEvent()` method

Make `WebSocket.prototype.addEventListener()` support an event listener
specified as an object with a `handleEvent()` method.

Fixes #2092

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[ci] Do not use the set-output command

The `set-output` command is deprecated. Use the `GITHUB_OUTPUT`
environment file.

Refs: https://github.blog/changelog/2022-10-11-github-actions-deprecating-save-state-and-set-output-commands/

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Support Windows named pipes (#2079)

Document how to connect to a named pipe endpoint and the limitations.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1808
Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/2075

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Rename the `invalidURLMessage` variable

Rename the `invalidURLMessage` variable to `invalidUrlMessage`.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Simplify the ws+unix: URL form

Remove the two forward slashes after the scheme. The URL is parsed in
the same way and it is easier to grok.

Author: Dathan
Message:
[doc] Revise `WebSocket#send()` docs for clarity (#2077)

Add reference to Node.js's own related documentation about the
constraints on `Object` values.

Fixes #2076

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[security] Fix same host check for ws+unix: redirects

Drop the `Authorization` and `Cookie` headers if the original request
for the opening handshake is sent to an IPC server and the client is
redirected to a TCP server (ws+unix: to ws: or wss:), and vice versa
(ws: or wss: to ws+unix).

Also drop the `Authorization` and `Cookie` headers if the original
request for the opening handshake is sent to an IPC server and the
client is redirected to another IPC server.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/commit/6946f5fe

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Prevent opening handshake headers from being overridden

Ensure that the `Connection`, `Sec-WebSocket-Key`,
`Sec-WebSocket-Version`, and `Upgrade` headers are not overridden.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/2048#issuecomment-1159832034

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Add the `WS_NO_{BUFFER_UTIL, UTF_8_VALIDATE}` variables

When set to non empty values, the `WS_NO_BUFFER_UTIL` and
`WS_NO_UTF_8_VALIDATE` environment variables, prevent the optional
`bufferutil` and `utf-8-validate` dependencies  from being required,
respectively.

These might be useful to enhance security in systems where a user can
put a package in the package search path of an application of another
user, due to how the Node.js resolver algorithm works.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [doc] Rename WS Error Codes section to Error codes

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Introduce the `'wsClientError'` event (#2046)

Add the ability to inspect the invalid handshake requests and respond
to them with a custom HTTP response.

Closes #2045

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [doc] Update the type of the `socket` argument

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[security] Drop sensitive headers when following insecure redirects

Drop the `Authorization` and `Cookie` headers if the original request
for the opening handshake is sent over HTTPS and the client is
redirected to the same host over plain HTTP (wss: to ws:).

If an HTTPS server redirects to same host over plain HTTP, the problem
is on the server, but handling this condition is not hard and reduces
the risk of leaking credentials due to MITM issues.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/commit/6946f5fe

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [ci] Exclude node 18 on Windows x86 from the test matrix

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Use consistent error messages

Make some server error messages consistent with the respective client
error messages.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Abort the handshake if the Upgrade header is invalid

Close the connection if the Upgrade header field in the HTTP response
contains a value that is not an ASCII case-insensitive match for the
value "websocket".

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Clarify why the handshake is aborted

Add more details about why the handshake is aborted in the HTTP
response.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/2045#issuecomment-1130081274

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Introduce the `'redirect'` event (#2030)

Add the ability to remove confidential headers on a per-redirect basis.

Closes #2014

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [minor] Make `abortHandshake()` emit the error in the next tick

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Do not use a relative URL

Use different username and password in the redirect URL.

Author: airtable-keyhanvakil
Message: [doc] document the default value of the `maxPayload` option (#2020)

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[security] Drop sensitive headers when following redirects (#2013)

Do not forward the `Authorization` and `Cookie` headers if the redirect
host is different from the original host.

Author: Sergey Bakulin
Message:
[feature] Introduce the `WebSocket` option (#2007)

Add the ability to use a custom class that extends the `WebSocket`
class.

Author: Robert Nagy
Message:
[fix] Use the byte length of the data (#2004)

Ensure that the correct length is used when framing the data.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[perf] Reduce buffer allocations (#2000)

Do not convert strings to `Buffer`s if data does not need to be masked.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1998

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Replace echo.websocket.org with websocket-echo.com

The echo.websocket.org service is no longer available.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [test] Do not call the `done` callback prematurely

Author: jugglinmike
Message:
[doc] Clarify interpretation of `verifyClient` (#1994)

Prior to this commit, the documentation for the `verifyClient` option
was somewhat confusing due to its use of the passive voice and an
uncommon interpretation of the term "arguments".

Explain the way `ws` interprets the value of `verifyClient` using an
active voice and more traditional meanings of "parameters" and
"arguments".

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [perf] Skip masking and unmasking if the masking key is zero

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Introduce the `generateMask` option

The `generateMask` option specifies a function that can be used to
generate custom masking keys.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1986
Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1988
Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1989

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[api] Add `WebSocket#pause()` and `WebSocket#resume()`

Add ability to pause and resume a `WebSocket`.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Resume the socket in the `CLOSING` state

When the value of the `readyState` attribute is `CLOSING`, the internal
socket might still be open. Resume it to read any remaining data and to
allow the connection to be closed cleanly.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Do not throw if the redirect URL is invalid (#1980)

If the redirect URL is invalid, then emit the error instead of throwing
it, otherwise there is no way to handle it.

Closes #1975

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Add missing label to the issue form

Fixes #1974

Author: Austin Cheney
Message: [minor] Allow to write frames with up to 2^48 - 1 bytes of data (#1973)

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Ignore the `threshold` option if context takeover is enabled

When context takeover is enabled, compress messages even if their size
is below the value of `threshold` option.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/1950

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[doc] Improve `WebSocket#{p{i,o}ng,send}()` documentation

Specify that an error is thrown if the ready state is `CONNECTING` and
that if an error occurs, the callback is called with the error as its
first argument.

Fixes #1953

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [doc] Remove no longer needed noop function from code snippet

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [ci] Use Github Actions for Windows x86 testing

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Skip unnecessary operations if the socket is already closed

There is no need to remove the already removed `socketOnData` listener,
resume the socket, and call `websocket.close()` if the socket is already
closed.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Resume the socket in the next tick

Ensure that `socket.resume()` is called after `socket.pause()`.

Fixes #1940

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Add `WebSocket.WebSocket{,Server}` aliases (#1935)

Add `WebSocket.WebSocket` as an alias for `WebSocket` and
`WebSocket.WebSocketServer` as an alias for `WebSocket.Server` to fix
name consistency and improve interoperability with the ES module
wrapper.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/1877
Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/1932

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[doc] Fix `createWebSocketStream()` documentation

The ES module wrapper exports `createWebSocketStream()` as a named
export and not as a static method of the `WebSocket` class.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[feature] Add ability to skip UTF-8 validation (#1928)

Add the `skipUTF8Validation` option to skip UTF-8 validation for text
and close messages.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/1878
Closes #1924

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Use an options object instead of positional arguments

Make the `Receiver` constructor take a single options object argument
instead of multiple positional arguments.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [test] Move code block closer to where it is used

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Fix misleading error message

Use the correct error message if the server sends an empty subprotocol
name.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Do not rely on undocumented behavior

Use the chunk returned by `socket.read()` to handle the buffered data
instead of relying on a `'data'` event emitted after the `'close'`
event.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/39639

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Overhaul event classes

- Remove non-standard `OpenEvent` class.
- Make properties read-only.
- Update constructor signatures to match the ones defined by the HTML
  standard.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Return `null` if the event handler is not set

Make the `onclose`, `onerror`, `onmessage`, and `onopen` getters return
`null` instead of `undefined` if the event handler is not set.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Make listeners added via event handler properties independent

Prevent the `onclose`, `onerror`, `onmessage`, and `onopen` getters and
setters from returning or removing event listeners added with
`WebSocket.prototype.addEventListener()`.

Also prevent `WebSocket.prototype.removeEventListener()` from removing
event listeners added with the `onclose`, `onerror`, `onmessage`, and
`onopen` setters.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/1818

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Ignore listeners not added with `WebSocket#addEventListener()`

Make `WebSocket.prototype.removeEventListener()` only remove listeners
added with `WebSocket.prototype.addEventListener()` and only one at
time.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Make `WebSocket#addEventListener()` ignore non standard events

Make `WebSocket.prototype.addEventListener()` a noop if the `type`
argument is not one of `'close'`, `'error'`, `'message'`, or `'open'`.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Call the callback with an error if the server is closed

Match the behavior of Node.js core `net.Server` and call the callback
of `WebSocketServer.prototype.close()` with an error if the server is
already closed.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Do not close existing connections

When `WebSocketServer.prototype.close()` is called, stop accepting new
connections but do not close the existing ones.

If the HTTP/S server was created internally, then close it and emit the
`'close'` event when it closes. Otherwise, if client tracking is
enabled, then emit the `'close'` event when the number of connections
goes down to zero. Otherwise, emit it in the next tick.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1902

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Add an ES module wrapper

Fixes #1886

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Do not decode `Buffer`s to strings

Avoid decoding text messages and close reasons to strings. Pass them as
`Buffer`s to the listeners of their respective events. Also, make
listeners of the `'message'` event take a boolean argument to speficy
whether or not the message is binary.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/1878
Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/issues/1804

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Throw an error if the connection URL is invalid

Make the `WebSocket` constructor throw a `SyntaxError` if the URL
contains a fragment identifier or if the URL's protocol is not one of
`'ws:'`, `'wss:'`, or `'ws+unix:'`.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Make the Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header parser stricter

Make the parser throw an error if the header field value is empty or if
it begins or ends with a white space.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Validate the Sec-WebSocket-Protocol header

Abort the handshake if the `Sec-WebSocket-Protocol` header is invalid.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Validate subprotocol names

Make the `WebSocket` constructor throw a `SyntaxError` if any of the
subprotocol names are invalid or duplicated.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Abort the handshake if the server is closing or closed

Prevent WebSocket connections from being established after
`WebSocketServer.prototype.close()` is called.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Emit the `'close'` event after the server is closed

Ensure that `WebSocketServer.prototype.close()` does not emit a
`'close'` event prematurely if called while the internal HTTP/S server
is closing.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Make the `{noS,s}erver`, and `port` options mutually exclusive

Remove ambiguity and prevent `WebSocketServer.prototype.address()` from
throwing an error if the `noServer` option is used along with the
`port` and/or `server` options.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Abort the handshake if an unexpected extension is received

Abort the handshake if the client receives a `Sec-WebSocket-Extensions`
header but no extension was requested. Also abort the handshake if the
server indicates an extension not requested by the client.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Fix close edge cases

Ensure that `socket.end()` is called if an error occurs simultaneously
on both peers.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1902

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [doc] Fix anchor tags for error codes

Author: Tim Perry
Message:
[minor] Attach error codes to all receiver errors (#1901)

Fixes #1892

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Don't call `ws.terminate()` unconditionally in `duplex._destroy()`

Call `ws.terminate()` only if `duplex.destroy()` is called directly by
the user and not indirectly by the listener of the `'error'` event of
the `WebSocket` object. Calling `ws.terminate()` right after the
`'error'` event is emitted on the `WebSocket` object, might prevent the
close frame from being sent to the other peer.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Close the connection cleanly when an error occurs

Instead of destroying the socket, try to close the connection cleanly
if an error (such as a data framing error) occurs after the opening
handshake has completed.

Also, to comply with the specification, use the 1006 status code if no
close frame is received, even if the connection is closed due to an
error.

Fixes #1898

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [doc] Remove unsafe regex from code snippet

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Rename certificates and private keys files

Rename `ca1-cert.pem` to `ca-certificate.pem`, `ca1-key.pem` to
`ca-key.pem`, `agent1-cert.pem` to `client-certificate.pem`, and
`agent1-key.pem` to `client-key.pem`.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [security] Update link to point to published security advisories

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Update certificates and private keys

Fixes #1890

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[security] Fix ReDoS vulnerability

A specially crafted value of the `Sec-Websocket-Protocol` header could
be used to significantly slow down a ws server.

PoC and fix were sent privately by Robert McLaughlin from University of
California, Santa Barbara.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[security] Remove reference to Node Security Project

The Node Security Platform service no longer exists. New security
advisories will be published to GitHub Security Advisories.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Fix case where `abortHandshake()` does not close the connection

On Node.js >= 14.3.0 `request.abort()` does not destroy the socket if
called after the request completed.

Fixes #1869

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Make UTF-8 validation work even if utf-8-validate is not installed

Fixes #1868

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [ci] Use a unique ID instead of commit SHA

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Recreate the inflate stream if it ends

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/37612

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Handle cases where the `'error'` event is emitted multiple times

The `'error'` event can be emitted multiple times by the
`http.ClientRequest` object in Node.js < 13. Handle the case properly.

Fixes #1819

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [test] Check configurability and enumerability of WebSocket properties

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Fix the enumerability of some properties

Make the `CONNECTING`, `OPEN`, `CLOSING`, `CLOSED`, `binaryType`,
`bufferedAmount`, `extensions`, `onclose`, `onerror`, `onmessage`,
`onopen`, `protocol`, `readyState`, and `url` properties enumerable.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Pass the request object to `server.handleUpgrade()` callback

Fixes #1813

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [codestyle] Use 80 characters per line in JSDoc comments

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [minor] Add missing parameters in JSDoc comments

Author: Eugene Maslovich
Message: [example] Write 401 response before destroying the socket (#1798)

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[meta] Remove 3rd-Eden from FUNDING.yml

3rd-Eden is not yet enrolled in GitHub Sponsors.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Take into account the data that is being compressed

Improve `websocket.bufferedAmount` accuracy by taking into account the
number of bytes of a message while it is being compressed.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [ci] Run the lint script only once

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [pkg] Do not run the lint script before the test script

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [minor] Add missing tag to JSDoc comment

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
Revert "[ci] Use GitHub Actions (#1644)"

This reverts commit 49ed88968d0abb04e6bc8c7a20f584ce2ab71289.

Message:
Revert "[ci] Test on node 14"

This reverts commit 78e1c01959c59e07a9e1a9f464dd90f8a012c4fb.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [ci] Update Coveralls GitHub Action to version 1.1.1

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Fix failing tests

Do not rely on the `'drain'` event for synchronous writes.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/32887

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Do not call `duplex.end()` prematurely

Keep the `WebSocket` connection open while the test is run.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/32780

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Call the `_final()` callback before destroying the stream

Ensure that `'finish'` event is emitted.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/32780

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[minor] Throw an error on invalid method usage

Throw an error if `WebSocketServer.prototype.completeUpgrade()` is
called more than once with the same socket argument.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
Revert "[minor] Throw an error on invalid usage"

This reverts commit 364126620bf3fe4e6e0042d3b74ec53b5ccbbb08.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
Revert "[minor] Set the flag to detect invalid API usage only when needed"

This reverts commit 91b5173c776881dc1a229ac5b0ba928dcb775602.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[doc] Fix example to not use deprecated property

Fixes #1743

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Make `WebSocket#{p{i,o}ng,close}()` check the data size

Throw an error if the data size is too large to fit in a control frame.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Call buffered send callbacks on abnormal closure (#1702)

If the socket is closed while data is being compressed, invoke the
current send callback and the buffered send callbacks with an error
before emitting the `'close'` event.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/30596

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Do not swallow errors emitted while destroying (#1672)

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Make `_final()` a noop if no socket is assigned

Prevent `_final()` from throwing an error if `duplex.end()` is called
while the websocket is closing and no socket is assigned to it.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[test] Use `WebSocket.CONNECTING` instead of 0

Use the `WebSocket.CONNECTING` constant instead of hardcoding its value.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Close the connection if the MASK bit is incorrectly set (#1681)

Follow the specification and close the connection when a non masked
frame is received on the server or a masked frame is received on the
client.

Refs: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6455#section-5.1

Closes #1679

Author: Ben Falconer
Message:
[fix] Allow close code 1014 (#1682)

IANA has assigned 1014 as "Bad Gateway".

Refs: https://www.iana.org/assignments/websocket/websocket.xhtml#close-code-number
Refs: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CloseEvent

Message:

`zlib.flush()` callback can be called if `zlib.close()` is called
while data is being processed.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Change `WebSocket#{p{i,o}ng,send}()` behavior (#1532)

- If the `readyState` attribute is `CONNECTING`, throw an exception.
- If the `readyState` attribute is `CLOSING` or `CLOSED`
  - Increase the `bufferedAmount` attribute by the length of the `data`
    argument in bytes.
  - If specified, call the `callback` function with an error.

Fixes #1515

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[major] Remove the `flags` argument (#1101)

The `flags` object specifies whether the received data is binary or not
and whether it was masked or not. This object is actually redundant and
therefore removed in this commit as the spec requires client-sent
frames to be masked and server-sent frame to be unmasked.

The `typeof` operator can be used to check whether the received data is
binary or not.

Author: Varun Malhotra
Message:
[feature] Allow path to be specified with UNIX domain sockets

This change allows URL path with params to be specified with
UNIX domain socket URLs.

An example URL with UNIX domain socket looks like:
  ws+unix:///absolule/path/to/uds_socket:/pathname?query_params

Note that ':' is the seprator between socket path and URL path.

Existing URLs like the following also work:
  ws+unix:///absolule/path/to/uds_socket

In the above case, path gets set to '/'.

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message: [perf] Enqueue send operations only when strictly necessary

Author: Luigi Pinca
Message:
[fix] Fix parser crash on synchronous socket error

This commit fixes an issue that could happen when the parser was
processing data and an error was emitted synchronously on the socket,
for example when writing to a socket whose connection had been
abruptly closed (ECONNRESET).
In these cases the parser was cleaned up prematurely and crashed when
trying to use resources no longer available.
